page.title: 01Streford/Felhampton
page.content: Stefford is a grade 2 listed. The Strefford square contains the hamlet of Strefford where there is one farm stead and 14 dwellings, the farming is arable, this being Beef and Sheep. Upper Affcot in this square, there are 7 houses plus a pub and one restaurant. The farming is mostly arable with part of a dairy farm on the east side of the square. The Felhampton square contains 8 houses including a farmstead. The shrewsbury to Hereford railway lines also runs through this square. The farming is arable. The A49 trunk road passes through each of the three squares. The Quinney brook runs through the Felhampton and Upper Affcot squares and is joined by the byne brook in the strefford square.
